image.altText: A bus driving over a bridge in Brisbane.

props.synopsis: Brisbane City Council is urging the state government to commit half a billion dollars to Brisbane's bus system or risk "disaster" in August when people rush for cheap fares.Â

title.children: '50 cent fares will be a 50-cent fail': Brisbane City Council warns state government over buses

image.altText: Three police officers walking in an underground car park

props.synopsis: SA Police says Westfield Marion's centre management issued an evacuation alarm after reports some of the people involved had weapons, including expandable batons.

title.children: Fight triggers lockdown at Adelaide's biggest shopping centre

image.altText: A man in a hoodie and a black baseball cap

props.synopsis: Shoppers and retail workers detail the terrifying moments they found themselves sprinting and screaming through Westfield Marion shopping centre in suburban Adelaide on a Sunday afternoon.

title.children: Eyewitnesses recount panic inside Westfield Marion after lockdown

image.altText: Text message scree in front of generic army background

props.synopsis: An independent inquiry into an ill-fated MRH-90 Taipan crash reveals the mindset of soldiers hours before the accident, amid claims of a "toxic" workplace culture.

title.children: Fatal army helicopter crash inquiry reveals gut-wrenching final messages between colleagues

image.altText: Fog lifts from a landscape in the Yarra Valley in the morning light

props.synopsis: As the bitter cold snap continues across central and eastern parts of the country, the Bureau of Meteorology reveals which places have had the most extreme temperatures during this event, and which towns lay claim as Australia's coldest in general.

title.children: These places lay claim to being the coldest in Australia, as the bitter cold snap continues

image.altText: Police in scrubs inspecting a parked car on a driveway.

props.synopsis: Forensic officers investigating the shooting death of Natalie Frahm in Mackay continued to work at the scene over the weekend. Could tougher firearms laws have prevented the tragedy?

title.children: Mackay shooting death of Natalie Frahm rocks community as gun union opposes proposed new police search laws

image.altText: A young girl sits in a wheelchair. Her eyes are closed.

props.synopsis: A Queensland family say they are hamstrung by bureaucracy as they try to make the most of their time left with their six-year-old daughter in palliative care.

title.children: 'Time is something we don't have': Family of dying six-year-old added to the public housing waitlist

image.altText: A young woman in a red jumper and large round glasses with long blonde hair and a neutral expression

props.synopsis: Failings by two of Australia's major IVF companies allowed a man to keep donating sperm over several years using different names. Katherine Dawson is now urgently trying to find her half-siblings.

title.children: Katherine's sperm donor father could have created up to 700 children. She has a message for her siblings

image.altText: Peter Austin 1

props.synopsis: Prices for kelpies have soared to record highs in recent times and for Peter Austin, of Blackbutt in Queensland, it is the perfect time to call it a day after breeding dogs for Japan, the US, Canada, and Mexico, in addition to Australia.

title.children: Why this renowned kelpie breeder is calling it a day in a red-hot market

image.altText: Luke Laulilii celebrates with Wests Tigers NRL teammate Lachlan Galvin after scoring a try.

props.synopsis: The Tigers run riot at Campbelltown, running in eight tries to hammer Canberra 48-24 and get just off the bottom of the NRL ladder.

title.children: Tigers climb off the bottom of the ladder by thrashing Raiders despite nervy moments after late sin-bin

image.altText: Marcus Stoinis holds his hands to his chest and yells in frustration

props.synopsis: Australia records a shock 21-run defeat to Afghanistan that throws its semifinal chances into jeopardy at the men's T20 World Cup.

title.children: Afghanistan posts historic win as Australia's T20 World Cup hopes take a blow

image.altText: A security guard tries to grab a pitch invader, who has grabbed onto Cristiano Ronaldo

props.synopsis: Cristiano Ronaldo enters the record books yet again, but pitch invaders make the Portuguese legend's afternoon uncomfortable, while contenders for worst miss and own goal of Euro 2024 emerge. Here are your five quick hits.Â

title.children: Euro 2024 quick hits: Ronaldo's surprising new record, pitch invader woes and the worst own goal of the tournament

image.altText: Two men in a collage

props.synopsis: The ABC has received 51 nominations, one of the highest tallies ever for the public broadcaster.

title.children: Tony Armstrong and Robert Irwin among the top nominations for the 2024 Logie Awards

image.altText: bio hazzard workers at a bird flu contaminated farm in glossodia in nsw

props.synopsis: An outbreak of bird flu has been detected on a second farm in Sydney's north-west, with more than 86,000 chickens to be culled.

title.children: Bird flu found at second poultry farm in Hawkesbury area â just kilometres away from site of initial outbreak

image.altText: Online trolls told Olivia Frazer she was 'the most hated person in Australia'

props.synopsis: Olivia went on Australia's biggest show to find love, but lost almost everything. She says she got a "villain edit" â so do they exist?

title.children: 'I signed up to be a b****, not a criminal': Australia's 'most-hated' TV villain speaks

image.altText: A graphic of a woman with brown hair and a piggy bank against a teal-coloured background.

props.synopsis: The average superannuation balance at retirement for people from non-English speaking backgrounds is about 30 per cent lower than the general population.Â

title.children: Why migrants are $140,000 worse off than people born in Australia

image.altText: A man with a beard in a blue shirt learning on a tractor.

props.synopsis:
Nuclear reactors, if they are built, will be in the backyards of farmers such as Darren Jensen. He's thrilled by the prospect, but not everyone in town is.

Â

title.children: Nuclear power could put these tiny towns in the national spotlight, but residents' opinions are divided

image.altText: David Crisafulli

props.synopsis: David Crisafulli insists he won't budge on his opposition to nuclear power â a position that's not sitting well with some of his federal colleagues.

title.children: David Crisafulli is on a collision course with federal colleagues over nuclear power

image.altText: A caravan beside a rock pool in outback Queensland.

props.synopsis: It is supposed to be peak tourism season, but locals in small outback tourist towns have never seen it so quiet and are worried businesses won't survive.

title.children: 'Perfect weather, fishing's great' but where are the tourists?

props.synopsis: Oh, I see â you're back with your tail between your legs after last week's abysmal effort.

title.children: Still think you're a trivia genius? Then let's play â¦ HARD!

image.altText: Comic book characters Deadpool and Wolverine walk towards the camera in full costume.

props.synopsis: While you could argue the Marvel Cinematic Universe is far from on its knees, all eyes are on the lone MCU film being released this year to save the day, or â Â at the very least â be a canary in the caped coal mine.

title.children: Is the Marvel Cinematic Universe doomed, or will Deadpool save the day?

image.altText: A woman sitting down drawing on a digital tablet using a digital pencil.

props.synopsis:
The Sydney artist's children's book illustrations were detailed and realistic. But after a brush with a deadly infection, she adapted to a new painting style.

Â 

Â

title.children: 'I'll always be an artist': Elizabeth's hands were amputated, but it didn't stop her painting

image.altText: Woman holding up a framed drawing of a stick figure with the words, 'Longing, longing, longing'

props.synopsis: The day after Zoe Strickland's son took his own life, she picked up a Sharpie pen and drew a picture. It would become the first entry in a series of grief diaries, and the birth of her stick figure character, Doodle Lady.

title.children: When Zoe's son died by suicide, Doodle Lady was born

image.altText: A photo showing an Indigenous woman sitting in a chair outside with building in the background.

props.synopsis: A first-of-its-kind renal dialysis clinic has opened in remote Central Australia, a region where one in 100 people are in need of the treatment amid a growing diabetes and kidney disease epidemic.

title.children: After three years away from home, Raelene can now have dialysis on country

image.altText: A man standing near a garage door, looking down, with a cigarette in his hand.

props.synopsis: Fourteen years of austerity measures and cuts to services haven't just left people feeling forgotten in Scotland's largest city â research has revealed the policies mean people are dying younger.

title.children: Inside the 'devastating effect' of austerity measures on a Scottish city

image.altText: Blurred image of an army vehicle

props.synopsis: Israeli soldiers tied a wounded Palestinian to their vehicle and drove him through the city of Jenin as Palestinians filmed the incident.Â

title.children: Israeli soldiers who drove with wounded Palestinian tied to their vehicle 'violated orders', military says

image.altText: Nigel Farage wags his finger in front of a blue BBC set.

props.synopsis: The Reform UK leader responds to criticism over his claims that the West provoked Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

title.children: Nigel Farage doubles down on claim the West provoked Russia's invasion of Ukraine

image.altText: Jackie Kennedy sits alongside JFK in the backseat of a convertible following his inauguration as US president in 1961.

props.synopsis: When costume designer Marion Boyce came upon a yellow Jean Patou hat as a 17 year old, little did she know that decades later it would end up on our TV screens. Â Â

title.children: The timeless elegance of sixties fashion bought to life on screen

image.altText: Elderly man in glasses, running in bush, tree behind him, orange bunting

props.synopsis: Still quick enough mentally and physically to post competitive orienteering times, Alex Tarr outclasses many of his younger opponents.

title.children: Octogenarian Alex Tarr is still running on the edge, winning orienteering's mental game

image.altText: Crowds walk down a street in Japan covered in colourful billboards.

props.synopsis: As a record number of Australians head to Japan, some restaurants and tourist attractions are implementing two-tiered pricing systems for visitors and locals.

title.children: Japan's tourist hot spots introduce two-tiered pricing systems for visitors and locals

image.altText: A sad-looking Putin, viewed from the side.

props.synopsis: When Vladimir Putin announced a military partnership with North Korea, he stepped across a red line drawn by one of the most advanced arms suppliers in the world.Â

title.children: While he was trying to make a friend in North Korea, Putin angered a very important player to the south

image.altText: Shiny monolith stands tall in las vegas

props.synopsis: A strange monolith found jutting from the rocks in a remote mountain range near Las Vegas has been taken down by authorities.

title.children: Another shiny monolith has popped up, this time in Las Vegas. What's going on?

image.altText: Anthony Albanese, wearing a suit and glasses, looking serious.

props.synopsis: The federal government has effectively shelved its push to introduce both extraordinary immigration powers and religious discrimination laws, with Labor offering few signs it will seek to deliver on its promised policies before the election.Â

title.children: Extraordinary immigration powers and religious protections shelved

image.altText: A group of people sitting at a table, holding up drinks and smiling. They are wearing aprons, but no other clothes.

props.synopsis: A community in New South Wales gets undressed to help its beloved aged care facility. The town of 2,000 people raised nearly $350,000 through fundraising efforts to reopen the centre for its elderly.

title.children: Town strips down to save its local aged care centre
